result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia J. Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Patricia J. Hardy in court.  There are no other appearances.  Discussion held.  Def states she did not pay the restitution, agent indicates it was paid.  Court reviews file, $250 was paid toward restitution.  Court grants judgment for unpaid balance, payments must be paid to COC.  Probation shall end on October 6, 2016.

Probation Intake Order
Sentencing hearing at 10-06-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant, Patricia J. Hardy in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. wants this taken care of today; State notes that he was not aware of same as there is no signed agreement; State notes will ask for 12 mo. probation with rest. to be paid $734.12 (may terminate early if all paid); discussion held; there is no JT date set; Court will take plea today and put off sentencing for 90 days; Court reviews right to counsel; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads guity to same; Court accepts plea, finds guilty and sets for sentencing (Def. to pay restitution)  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  DA notes that the restitution w/o surcharge is $667.38 to BP to be paid through clerk of courts office

Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:27 - Defendant, Patricia J. Hardy in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters Not Guilty pleas for Defendant. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
